bubble_sort.title: Bubble Sort Basic Algorithm
bubble_sort.description: Given an array of unsorted numbers, implement a basic bubble sorting algorithm which takes that input and orders the numbers from lowest to highest using that implementation
bubble_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
bubble_sort.output_desc: A new array of numbers sorted from lowest to highest using bubble sort
constraints: The sorting must be done using bubble sort. Other sorting implementations will not suffice

bubble_sort.title: Count swaps in Bubble Sort
bubble_sort.description: Given an array of integers, implement a bubble sort algorithm which not only sorts the integers in ascending order, but also counts the amount of times a number was swapped during the sorting process. Return the number of swaps as an integer.
bubble_sort.input_desc: An array of integers arr where 1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000.
bubble_sort.output_desc: An integer representing the total number of swaps the bubble sort algorithm performs to sort the array.
constraints: You must implement bubble sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Count every swap between neighboring elements.

bubble_sort.title: Bubble Sort Strings
bubble_sort.description: Given an array of strings, implement a bubble sort algorithm which sorts the array in ascending alphabetical order. Return the sorted array.
bubble_sort.input_desc: An array of strings arr, where 1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000. Each string consists of lowercase or uppercase English letters.
bubble_sort.output_desc: A new array representing the finished product after alphabetically sorting using a bubble_sort algorithm
constraints: You must implement bubble sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
When sorting make sure to know uppercase letters come before lowercase letters in ASCII order.

bubble_sort.title: Bubble Sort Iteration Counter
bubble_sort.description: Given an array of unsorted integers, implement a bubble sorting algorithm which sorts the array from lowest to highest. Instead of returning the sorted array, count the number of iterations taken to fully sort the array. An iteration is defined as one complete traversal of the array (from the first element to the last) where neighboring elements may be swapped.
bubble_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
bubble_sort.output_desc: An integer representing the number of iterations taken to complete the bubble_sort process
constraints: You must write bubble sort yourself; you cannot use built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort().
If an iteration makes no swaps, count that as the last run-through, since the array is already sorted, and return the full count.

bubble_sort.title: Custom Bubble Sort
bubble_sort.description: Given an array of integers, implement a bubble sort algorithm with a single constraint. You can only swap neighboring elements just like a normal bubble sort algorithm; however, the left element has to be even. Return the sorted array according to this rule. If the array cannot be fully sorted due to the constraint, return the partially sorted array.
bubble_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
bubble_sort.output_desc: An array of integers representing the array sorted as much as possible under the constraint.
constraints: You must implement bubble sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Only swap neighboring elements if the left element is even.
Stop iterating early if no swaps are possible in a full iteration.

merge_sort.title: Merge Two Sorted Arrays
merge_sort.description: Given two sorted arrays, merge them into one single sorted array in ascending order.
merge_sort.input_desc: Two arrays of numbers, arr1 and arr2, each sorted in ascending order. (1 ≤ len(arr1), len(arr2) ≤ 1000)
merge_sort.output_desc: A new array containing all elements from arr1 and arr2 in ascending order.
constraints: You must implement the merge process manually; using built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not permitted
The inputs are guaranteed to be sorted arrays

merge_sort.title: Recursive Maximum of an Array
merge_sort.description: Given an array of integers, find the maximum value within the array using recursion. Loops and built-in functions like max() are not permitted.
merge_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
merge_sort.output_desc: A single integer which represents the largest number in the given array
constraints: You must implement the search process using recursion
Using built-in functions like max() or loops are not permitted

merge_sort.title: Merge Sort Basic Algorithm
merge_sort.description: Given an array of unsorted numbers, implement a basic merge sorting algorithm which takes that input and puts the integers in ascending order using the merge sort algorithm.
merge_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
merge_sort.output_desc: A new array of numbers sorted from lowest to highest using merge sort
constraints: The sorting must be done using merge sort. Other sorting implementations will not suffice
Built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Your solution must use a recursive divide-and-conquer approach

merge_sort.title: Count Inversions using Merge Sort
merge_sort.description: Using elements of the Merge Sort algorithm, count the number of inversions found in the given array after recursively splitting it into halves. An inversion is defined as a pair of elements (arr[i], arr[j]) such that i < j and arr[i] > arr[j].
merge_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000).
merge_sort.output_desc: An integer representing the total number of inversions in the array.
constraints: You may use recursion and the Merge Sort concept but do not implement the entire sort
Aim for O(n log n) complexity using the merge idea.
Built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Resource: https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/dsa/inversion-count-in-array-using-merge-sort/

merge_sort.title: Counting Reverse Pairs
merge_sort.description: Given an array of integers, count the number of reverse pairs in the given array. A reverse pair is defined as a pair (i, j) where i < j and arr[i] > 2 * arr[j]. Implement a solution using a modified Merge Sort algorithm.
merge_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 100000).
merge_sort.output_desc: An integer representing the total number of reverse pairs in the array.
constraints: You may use recursion and the Merge Sort concept but do not implement the entire sort
Aim for O(n log n) complexity using the merge idea.
Built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Only pairs where i < j are considered.

selection_sort.title: Find the Minimum Index
selection_sort.description: Given an array of unsorted integers, find the index of the smallest element in the array. Using built-in functions like min() is not permitted
selection_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 100000).
selection_sort.output_desc: An integer representing the index of the smallest element in the array. If there are multiple occurrences of the minimum, return the first index.
constraints: You must find the minimum element manually; built-in functions like min() are not allowed.

selection_sort.title: Selection Sort Basic Algorithm
selection_sort.description: Given an array of unsorted numbers, sort the array in ascending order using the selection sort algorithm.
selection_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 100000).
selection_sort.output_desc: A new array of numbers sorted from lowest to highest using selection sort.
constraints: You must implement selection sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
You must repeatedly find the minimum element and move it to the correct position.

selection_sort.title: Custom Selection Sort Comparison
selection_sort.description: Given an array of integers, sort the array in ascending order using selection sort, but with a custom comparison rule. Even numbers should come before odd numbers. Within each group of numbers, maintain ascending order. You must implement this using selection sort manually; built-in sorting functions are not allowed.
selection_sort.input_desc: An array of numbers arr (1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 100000).
selection_sort.output_desc: A new array of numbers sorted according to the custom rule.
constraints: You must implement selection sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Even numbers always precede odd numbers.
Maintain ascending order within the even and odd groups.

selection_sort.title: Selection Sort Students by Score
selection_sort.description: Given a list of student records, each containing a name and a score, sort the list in descending order of scores using selection sort. If two students have the same score, maintain their original relative order. Built-in sorting functions are not allowed.
selection_sort.input_desc: An array of objects, where each object has 'name' (string) and 'score' (integer). The array length is 1 ≤ len(arr) ≤ 1000.
selection_sort.output_desc: A new array of student records sorted in descending order by score.
constraints: You must implement selection sort manually; built-in sorting functions like sorted() or .sort() are not allowed.
Sort in descending order by score.
Maintain relative order for students with the same score.
